Sandra TeoLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 14 Mar 2019Hi there! Greed causes investors to break one of the most important rule in investing that is buy low sell high. Greeder investors often buy high out of greed and sell low out of fear, despite knowing on an intellectual level that it is a bad idea. For instance, during the dotcom boom in the late 1990s, investors got greedy, fueling further greed and leading securities to be grossly overpriced which created a bubble. When the bubble burst in the mid-2000 it lead to depressed indexes through to 2001.0 comments0
